etymologies: Middle English: from Old French quaier, from Latin quaterni ‘set of four’

definitions: four sheets of paper or parchment folded to form eight leaves, as in medieval manuscripts.
shortDefinitions: four sheets of paper or parchment folded to form eight leaves

definitions: any collection of leaves one within another in a manuscript or book

examples.text: the scribe numbered the quires of his manuscript as well as the leaves

shortDefinitions: any collection of leaves one within another in manuscript or book

definitions: 25 (formerly 24) sheets of paper; one twentieth of a ream

examples.text: the package contained two quires of tracing paper
